titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 41, PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF A RULE SUBMITTED BY THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 40...

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 41, PROVIDING FOR CONGRESSIONAL DISAPPROVAL OF A RULE SUBMITTED BY THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION, AND PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.J. RES. 40...; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 17

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of a rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to ``Disclosure of Payments by Resource Extraction Issuers''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 41, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of a rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to ``Disclosure of Payments by Resource Extraction Issuers'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 187 nays, Roll No. 72.<P/>H. Res. 71, the rule providing for consideration of the joint resolutions (H.J. Res. 41) and (H.J. Res. 40) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 231 ayes to 191 noes, Roll No. 71, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 191 nays, Roll No. 70.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of a rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to ``Disclosure of Payments by Resource Extraction Issuers''
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.J. Res. 41, providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of a rule submitted by the Securities and Exchange Commission relating to ``Disclosure of Payments by Resource Extraction Issuers'', by a yea-and-nay vote of 235 yeas to 187 nays, Roll No. 72.<P/>H. Res. 71, the rule providing for consideration of the joint resolutions (H.J. Res. 41) and (H.J. Res. 40) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 231 ayes to 191 noes, Roll No. 71, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 191 nays, Roll No. 70.

titleInfo.title: MOTION TO PROCEED TO LEGISLATIVE SESSION

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO PROCEED TO LEGISLATIVE SESSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 17
LEGISLATIVE SESSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 17
THE JOURNAL; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 17

congVote.result: The PRESIDING OFFICER. The Journal stands approved to date.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of H. J. Res. 38, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of the Interior known as the Stream Protection Rule, after agreeing to the motion to proceed.<P/>By 56 yeas to 42 nays (Vote No. 42), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this measure, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 55 yeas to 42 nays (Vote No. 41), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Legislative Session.<P/>A unanimous-consent-time agreement was reached providing for further consideration of the joint resolution at approximately 11 a.m., on Thursday, February 2, 2017; and that there be six hours of debate remaining, equally divided in the usual form.<P/>By 54 yeas to 44 nays (Vote No. 39), Senate approved the Journal to date.

titleInfo.title: MOTION TO PROCEED TO EXECUTIVE SESSION

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO PROCEED TO EXECUTIVE SESSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 17

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of the nomination of Elisabeth Prince DeVos, of Michigan, to be Secretary of Education.<P/>A motion was entered to close further debate on the nomination, and, in accordance with the provisions of rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, a vote on cloture will occur on Friday, February 3, 2017.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this nomination, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 53 yeas to 44 nays (Vote No. EX. 38), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Legislative Session.<P/>By 52 yeas to 47 nays (Vote No. 40), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Executive Session to consider the nomination.

extension.searchTitle: EXECUTIVE SESSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 17

titleInfo.title: MOTION TO PROCEED TO LEGISLATIVE SESSION

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO PROCEED TO LEGISLATIVE SESSION; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 17

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of H. J. Res. 38, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of the Interior known as the Stream Protection Rule, after agreeing to the motion to proceed.<P/>By 56 yeas to 42 nays (Vote No. 42), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this measure, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 55 yeas to 42 nays (Vote No. 41), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Legislative Session.

titleInfo.title: DISAPPROVING A RULE SUBMITTED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR--MOTION TO PROCEED

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of H. J. Res. 38, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of the Interior known as the Stream Protection Rule, after agreeing to the motion to proceed.<P/>By 56 yeas to 42 nays (Vote No. 42), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.

Senate began consideration of H. J. Res. 38, disapproving the rule submitted by the Department of the Interior known as the Stream Protection Rule, after agreeing to the motion to proceed.<P/>By 56 yeas to 42 nays (Vote No. 42), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to consideration of the joint resolution.<P/>Prior to the consideration of this measure, Senate took the following action:<P/>By 55 yeas to 42 nays (Vote No. 41), Senate agreed to the motion to proceed to Legislative Session.
